Reviews.Title: This is the future of Pro Photography
Reviews.Author: Barticus Rex
Reviews.Content: I have both the E-M1 and the E-M5 which isn't going anywhere.  Basically, for me it comes down to this:  If I'm using my 12-40 F2.8 'pro' zoom lens or the upcoming 40-150 F2.8 'pro' lens I'll use the E-M1 with the requisite battery grip.  If I'm using one of the dinky little wonderful prime lenses I tend to use my E-M5.  Image quality is nearly identical, and it comes down to balance and ergonomics. For formal events or weddings my primary weapon is my E-M1.  And as I happen across opportunities to use the prime lenses, particularly in low light, I shift over to the E-M5.  But the beauty of having this system of cameras and lenses is I can configure any way I like.  So the E-M1 is the king of the hill with its amazing image stabilization and wonderful access to camera adjustments.  And for situations where the more compact configuration is advantageous I go for the E-M5.  The main thing is to get the camera that feels good to you and then get out there and snap away.  The E-M1 is the superior camera, but I'm a sucker for all things cool and little where the E-M5 still gets the nod.

Reviews.Title: Single Kit - Camera & Lens
Reviews.Author: Nathan M Dornquast
Reviews.Content: There have been many reviews for the camera and lens by people much more qualified than I.  I will add, however, that coming from an om-d em-5 (previous gen); I am very pleased with addition options (wifi, HDR+, viewfinder, display, grip, etc).  Especially happy with button layout - which on the 5 was always problematic for me (small, hard to reach).What I will contribute is to this OMD EM1 + 12-40mm kit.  I was not sure what to expect.  I have not seen any similar kit locally in the USA.  Here, I would spend $1399 for camera body and $999 for separate lens.  +tax.  I was especially concerned as Seller sells some "grey market" products.  No worries.  This is an Olympus camera + lens kit.  Fully retail items.  Items are packaged in same box from Olympus.  Will upload photo of box.  I don't have any issues with this.  Appears full retail products with nice lens bag, caps, etc.New EM-1 and 12-40mm F2.8 very powerful combination.Ordered from D-Solutions Saturday night.  Paid ~$15 for expedited 3 day shipping.  They shipped from Korea Monday.  I received (MN, USA) Tuesday at noon.  W00t!Update.  I don't see how to upload photo to Amazon anymore. Reviews.Title: FAST!!!  Worth the money!
Reviews.Author: Francois Tcha "Frank The Tank"
Reviews.Content: The feel of the camera is very nice and the layout of the buttons is perfect.  It's not too small and not too big.  Even with the lens the camera isn't heavy.The camera and lens are fast and smooth.  I can catch my little 22 months old running around easily.  I had a very hard time with my older camera.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who's looking at getting a camera and have the budget.  This kit won't disappoint you.I also want to thank D-Solution for express shipping (DHL) this baby out to me within 3 days.  I ordered the camera on Sunday, and it was shipped on Tuesday and got here on Wednesday.  WOW!  Great customer service.
